subSections.text:

From {{bor|ja|ltc|sort=しょ|-}} {{ltc-l|所}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|ところ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK,SMK5|acc2=3|acc2_ref=NHK,SMK5}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|所で|ところ で}}: [[by the way]], [[incidentally]]
* {{ja-r|所々|ところどころ}}, {{ja-r|所所|ところどころ}}, {{ja-r|処々|ところどころ}}, {{ja-r|処処|ところどころ}}: [[here and there]]
* {{ja-r|所へ|ところ へ}}: [[thereupon]]
* {{ja-r|所もある|ところ も ある}}: some, sometimes
* {{ja-r|国%所|くに%ところ}}: [[country]] of [[birth]], [[birthplace]]
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|とこ}}

Listed in some sources as an abbreviation of ''tokoro'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>  However, this is also listed as cognate with {{m|ja|床||tr=toko|raised area; bed}},<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> which term already appears in use as far back as the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'' (c. 759 CE), one of the oldest Japanese texts.<ref>{{RQ:Manyoshu|14|3554}}, text [http://jti.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man14Yo.html#3554 here]</ref>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|とこ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|とこ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=とこ|informal|spoken}} {{n-g|see the senses for '''tokoro''' above}}

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The ''toko'' reading in modern Japanese is regarded as the informal and spoken version of ''tokoro'' above.
